place.name: BURMINGTON
place.gazetteerText: BURMINGTON, a parish in Shipston-on-Stour district, Warwick; on the river Stour, 2 miles S by E of Shipston-on-Stour, and 3 ESE of Moreton r. station. It has a post office under Shipston-on-Stour. Acres, 808. Real property, £1,793. Pop., 212. Houses, 46. The manor belonged, in the time of Henry VI., to Sir Humphrey Stafford; and passed to the Strangeways. The living is a p. curacy, annexed to the vicarage of Wolford in the diocese of Worcester. The church was recently rebuilt. There is a free school. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
